main event: A bright, circular or spherical object was observed at Keesler AFB, Mississippi, moving slowly downward and increasing in brightness.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for about 15 seconds before starting to move slowly downward, increasing in brightness slightly.
The object moved in a semi-elliptic trajectory toward the southwest and then faded out and disappeared.
Another sighting involved an object that appeared to be a high-flying aircraft leaving a fluorescent contrail, but the object itself was not visible.
The second object ceased making a contrail at an elevation of 30 degrees and appeared to drift due south for about 20 minutes before the contrail disappeared instantly to the southeast.
The weather conditions were clear with light, high scattered clouds and good visibility at the time of the sightings.
sighted object: a bright, circular or spherical object and a high-flying object leaving a fluorescent contrail
witnesses: Lt Col Lester Bridges, Capt Joseph H. Lyle, A2C John B. Seburn, and Sgt Elmer J. Olson
